oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The SIMION 3D Version 6 program has been used to find the potential distributions in various hexapole and octopole assemblies with rods of circular cross section, mounted inside a shield electrode. The deviations of these potentials from the theoretical potentials of an ideal geometry have been computed and plotted. From the study of several geometries, each with different rod to held radius ratios (r(rod),/r(o)), an optimum value for the ratio that gives least deviations has been found for both the hexapole and the octopole geometries. The optimum value of (r(rod)/r(o)) for a hexapole is 0.5375 and that for the octopole is 0.355. (Int J Mass Spectrom 202 (2000) 31-36) (C) 2000
